website_summaries.verdict: The reaction of people towards the Mizuno Wave Inspire 16 has been positive. The elements that work together to make this road running shoe as efficient as possible are mostly in line with expectations. The stable ride and the supportive technologies are of particular note. Additionally, the shoe’s low weight and high-level comfort make it ideal for daily wear.Fans of stability shoes that can handle any activity can enjoy the Wave Inspire 16.
pros: The Mizuno Wave Inspire 16 is lauded for providing responsible stability throughout the running session
This stability running shoe is praised for having an uncluttered look that is appealing to the eyes
Several consumers have noticed the responsive and supportive midsole unit
Most people report that in-shoe quivering is prevented thanks to the padded tongue and collar and the supportive upper construction
The lightweight configuration of this Mizuno running shoe is appreciated by those who don’t want a cumbersome stability shoe
cons: Some testers have noted that the outsole rubber has quickly separated from the midsole after merely a few uses
The toe box of this shoe is apparently a source of discomfort as it tended to bunch the toes together

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy the previous model
customer_reviews.text: The Mizuno Wave Inspire 15 is one of my all-time favorite shoes. So I was anxious to see what improvements were made in the Inspire 16. The answer: Zero. In fact, the 16 is a downscaled, lower quality version of the 15. Less cushioning, less comfort, and cheaper construction. My biggest beef is the reduction in the foam lining around the heel collar. On my first run with the 16, I came back with a broken blister on my ankle from abrasion with the collar. There is a bloodstain on the inside of my right shoe if Amazon wants proof.
customer_reviews.author: Francis W. Shock

customer_reviews.title: Wore Out In 4 Months, With Minor Use
customer_reviews.text: Was actually a nice shoe for the first few months. Lightweight yet supportive. I have probably gone for a dozen 2-3 mile runs in these. I mostly bought them for walking, going to the gym and golfing. After 4 months they have developed a hole in the padding behind my heel on both shoes for some unknown reason. Needless to say, they are now unwearable. Very disappointed. I have owned several pairs of Mizuno Wave Riders in the past that have lasted for YEARS, so not sure what happened to this model.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Addison

customer_reviews.title: Not a distance shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased countless running shoes, but never with this brand so I wanted to give it a try. They are not terrible shoes, but I strongly disliked them for distance running. If you run more than a 5k they start to give, and don’t support at all after that. They also feel a bit flat, which is surprising with the design. If you are someone who runs more than 5ks on average, I strongly recommend a different shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Simply Excelent!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a top shoe for marathon training, you can manage all kind of distances and in my recomendation, a pace between 5min*km to above, it is not (neceserally) a speed shoe, its more like a balanced training shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Genaro Soriano

customer_reviews.title: Not like past years models
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Mizunos for years with no problems. This pair fits well, but tears up my feet to the point I can't wear them anymore. Specifically, I literally get cuts on the balls of my feet and the side digs into my ankles. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E DeMarshall

customer_reviews.title: Does not need to be broken in at all.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered many run shoes through amazon. Once you know your size, you will never have to go into a store to purchase. This shoe did not disappoint! Smooth and did not need to be broken in at all. They are designed for mod overpronaters, and a great stability shoe. Worth the price, will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: radiah brooks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my last pair of Mizuno Wave Nirvanas which were discontinued eons ago (I had purchased several pairs at that time and just went through my last). This is the first time I have purchased running shoes without trying them on first (not recommended, but desperate times...). I bought a half-size larger than usual because I have Morton's toes and had developed black toenails (first time in 40 years of running). I must say I love these every bit as much as the Wave Nirvanas and they are much lighter. Very comfortable with good stability. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Doug (dmartin)

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've been with the wave inspires for 4 years, including 4 marathons. My favorite brand of running shoe, as I have flat feet and pronate. This shoe usually does wonders for me. However, this year, it feels less cushioned and supportive. The toe box is less roomier. I've been running on a pair of the 16s for 6 weeks now at 25 miles/week. I'm definitely experiencing some knee and leg pain that I don't normally have. My calves have been unusually tight. The only thing I can attribute that to is the change in shoe design.
customer_reviews.author: Phil McKrakin

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe and my favorite running shoe I’ve had.
customer_reviews.text: I had the inspire 15s and loved them, had to get these because I couldn’t find the 15s in my size but they’re just as good. My favorite running shoes I’ve ever had and lasted more miles than most I've had. probably have 30 or 40 miles on them so far and all good so far. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: The best so far
customer_reviews.text: I started with Asics then I visited a local store to analyze foot strike and they told me I need stability shoes. I switched to Brooks Adrenaline GTS and I went through a couple pairs without any problem. Suddenly, my feet hurt badly for any shoes: asics, brooks and adidas. I picked up these for on sale just thinking of getting some new shoes but now I found out that my feet recover much faster with these shoes. I can walk daily w/o getting hurt which I couldn't do with my old shoes.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My Achilles Tendinitis was gone after wearing these shoes. The heel drop is a little higher than other brands with shoes in the same category, preventing my Achilles’ tendon from over extending. Great energy return due to the Wave sandwiched in the sole. Absorbs impact well but doesn’t feel over cushy. The second shoelace hole is off set lower than the others, relieving any pressure points on top of your foot. Large toe box allows for toes to expand. Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Raffi Manoukian

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is not a very good quality shoe. This isy second time buying this brand on Amazon. The front part of the sole comes off within few weeks and the return window is small and closes for return. I wasted the money that I spent on Amazon- at least if I would have bought this at a shoe store, I can get a refund for the bad quality.
customer_reviews.author: CustomerX

customer_reviews.title: Sent to son at BASIC ARMY TRAINING
customer_reviews.text: Half way through basic training, my son's running shoes blew out. His drill instructor suggested he order these. I had them delivered straight to the post from Amazon. He received them quickly and says they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: rbh

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is very different from all past shoes in the same line. The run is no longer as comfortable as it used to be. Have put about 100 miles on this pair and have never said “wow I love these.” As I used to.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Toes area cramped compared to the Inspire 13
customer_reviews.text: I basically just want another pair of my Inspire 13s. These, however, do not fit. The toe area is cramped. It's narrower with a lower roof. I have narrow feet, too. What a bummer...
customer_reviews.author: jingles

customer_reviews.title: Built worse than before but costs as much as ever
customer_reviews.text: Built somewhat worse than the previous iteration but costs as much as ever. Redesigned toe with interior cap too snug, causes blisters, & doesn’t fit as well overall. Heel lining began tearing within a month. I’d search for a different brand if that weren’t such a huge effort & literal pain.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Gallina

customer_reviews.title: Good for my over-pronation, look and feel good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after reading reviews of shoes good for people with over-pronation and these seem to do the job and very comfortable. They look good too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes. This is a really good pair of sneakers. The previous incarnation was better but this is really good!!
customer_reviews.author: P.Edward

customer_reviews.title: Good Sole Padding
customer_reviews.text: Bought to support my foot during recovery from a stress fracture. My normal running shoes are minimal and don’t protect the foot at all. I’m using these to transition back and they’re pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Klechka

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a runner and has tried multiple brands of running shoes and says these are the best. He says that they are super light, but give him great support.
customer_reviews.author: Rosaoddo

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe very light quite airy and provides perfect support. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm4bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Solid running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is comfortable and fits true to size for the wide version. Always bought Mizuno shoes in the past and not disappointed this time either.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: A light and handsome trainer BUT expensive!
customer_reviews.text: The look and feel is inspiring. The question is: How long will those feather light soles survive the pavement and maybe the occasional trail?
customer_reviews.author: MC runner

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous version of these that I enjoyed, so decided to get the new one, and glad I did. They're comfortable, hold up well in a little bit of rain, and give me that extra bounce when I run
customer_reviews.author: noah

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Mizuno is the only running shoe I buy... always quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nun ya business

customer_reviews.title: great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have the flattest feet in the world, and would get inflamed tendons from over pronation after about 6 miles. I no longer have any pain after running in these, and some light arch exercises for my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Wilhite

customer_reviews.title: Don’t make them like they used to
customer_reviews.text: Tread on heel separated after 2 months of light use (walking, running on treadmill)
customer_reviews.author: sgm

customer_reviews.title: Like better then wave rider
customer_reviews.text: Switched to these from rider 18. Riders are much harder ride and not as good of a stability shoe. I rolled my ankles a good bit trail running in the riders and down hill beet my knees up. These are a softer ride with what feels like the same support. I run no more then 3 miles at a time outdoors with many trails, but also wear my running shoes to work in medical field wear I am on my feet all day. My knees feel better l. I am enjoying these shoes very much and they are worth $100. Will continue to come back to Mizuno.
customer_reviews.author: BigMack

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought the shoes for my husband who is a runner. New shoe replaced 15 WaveRunner. Great support on heels to prevent over rotation of ankles. Excellent shoes for long distance running.
customer_reviews.author: Bren M

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable show. It felt as if I was walking on clouds with how soft they are and extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Howard

customer_reviews.title: Year after year
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Mizuno Inspire model for years, one or two pairs per year and it always fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Pascal Renault

customer_reviews.title: Very good pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: No complaints because the shoes are lightweight, comfortable and provide solid support.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H Moore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and great support
customer_reviews.text: These fit true-to-size for me. I wear a size 10.5 and these fit perfectly as a 10.5. I love how they are supportive and a little more substantial than so many running shoes sold today. I know the huge trend right now is to go very lightweight, but I like shoes that are more constructed and sturdy. The lightweight ones fall apart on me in like a month. These are extremely comfortable for street or running wear. They also look sharp. I’ve worn Mizuno for years and have never been disappointed. This is another great shoe from them.
customer_reviews.author: unitydienes

customer_reviews.title: My son loves these shoes
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old loves these shoes. He typically likes shoes that are cushioned well, and he says this pair feels great on his feet. He has a wide foot, and the Mizuno Wave provides ample room for his feet. He uses them primarily as an everyday shoe, and when they have hard surface practice for lacrosse.
customer_reviews.author: Water Monkey

customer_reviews.text: I received these for my father to try out and he loves them. He said that the were really lightweight, had great ankle And arch support and we’re comfortable for an extended period of time. Their color was very versatile and matched many outfits and they were easy to wipe clean. They fit true to size and were accurate with the description. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Werner

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband and he likes to wear them while jogging and at the gym. He says that they fit him very well and they are very comfortable. Neither of us were familiar with this brand but these are high quality shoes that you don't have to spend $200 for.
customer_reviews.author: NaughtiLiterati

customer_reviews.title: Fit and look great
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable shoes that look nice and fit to size. My husband needed a new pair of shoes and these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime G

product_meta.title: Mizuno Men's Wave Inspire 16 Road Running Shoe
product_meta.description: The Wave inspire 16 gives you an unbelievably quick and stable ride. Impact-absorbing midsole and smooth ride support Wave technology bring an ideal balance of cushion and lightness to every step, along with a smooth transition. An all-new upper features engineered mesh for a soft, breathable fit, with internal toe cap for a sleeker look-and-feel. Take your daily runs to the next level with the ultimate in performance and comfort.
feature_bullets: This favorite stability trainer is a workhorse. Use for fast track workouts All the way up to a marathon distance
Smoothride support wave brings an ideal balance of cushion and lightness in every step
Premium Sockliner for increased cushioning and comfort
All new engineered Mesh upper for a soft and breathable fit
